name: Engage Users During Cybersecurity Awareness Month
title: Engage Users During Cybersecurity Awareness Month
body:
Observed every October, Cybersecurity Awareness Month provides an opportunity to raise awareness and improve your organization's security culture. You can teach and encourage your users all month long by following the Weekly Planners found in our Cybersecurity Awareness Month Resource Kits.

You can find links to our available resource kits in the table below:

Subscription Level Resource Kit Link

Gold and Platinum

 Cybersecurity Awareness Month Resource Kit
Diamond Cybersecurity Awareness Month Resource Kit

In your KSAT console, you’ll find two new landing pages and four new phishing templates, which have been localized into all of our supported languages. These resources relate to the topic covered in each week of the Weekly Planner. We recommend using these landing pages and phishing templates together for a cohesive and engaging learning experience. To increase participation with your users, we recommend enabling the Leaderboard. For more information, see the Learner Experience (LX) section of our KnowBe4 Console Account Settings: Training article.

Tip: Gamification helps make training fun and engaging while enabling your users to retain more information. For more information on how to gamify your security awareness training, see our Gamification Options PDF guide.

To learn more about these resources and how to share them with your users, see the section below.

Cybersecurity Awareness Month Landing Pages and Phishing Templates

For Cybersecurity Awareness Month, we created four phishing templates and two new landing pages. Each phishing template is an example of a common cybersecurity threat, such as social engineering and malicious URLs. Each landing page teaches users how to protect themselves and your organization from these threats.

If you would like to preview the Cybersecurity Awareness Month phishing templates, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to Phishing > Phishing Templates.
  2. Select System Templates.
  3. Copy a title from the list below to search in the search bar on the right side of the page for the phishing template you would like to preview:
    • [[email]] Password Alert (Link) (Spoofs Domain) (Branded)
    • ChatGPT: Your Custom ChatGPT AI Portal is Now Live (Link)
    • Ransomware Scan (Link) (Spoofs Domain) (Branded)
    • Microsoft 365: Your incident has been opened (Link)
  4. Once you find the phishing template, select the eye icon next to the title to preview it.

If you would like to preview Cybersecurity Awareness Month landing pages, follow the steps below:

  1. Navigate to Phishing > Landing Pages.
  2. Select System Landing Pages. Copy a title from the list below to search in the search bar on the right side of the page for the landing page you would like to preview:
    • Browser Language Detecting: Welcome to the Awareness Arcade
    • Browser Language Detecting: Could this be Game Over?
  3. Once you find the landing page, select the eye icon next to the title to preview it.

These phishing templates and landing pages are designed to be used together in four Phishing Security Tests (PSTs), one for each week of Cybersecurity Awareness Month. To create these PSTs, navigate to the Phishing tab and select + Create Phishing Campaign. Then, select the recommended settings below and customize the campaign as needed.

Tip: For general information about phishing campaigns, see our Create and Manage Phishing Campaigns article.
  1. Template Topics: Select Cybersecurity Awareness Month .

  2. Template Selection: Select Specific Template (Choose one template). Then, select one of the templates listed below. The area below the arrow in the screenshot will show these four templates in a drop-down menu:
    • Week 1: [[email]] Password Alert (Link) (Spoofs Domain) (Branded)
    • Week 2: ChatGPT: Your Custom ChatGPT AI Portal is Now Live (Link)
    • Week 3: Ransomware Scan (Link) (Spoofs Domain) (Branded)
    • Week 4: Microsoft 365: Your incident has been opened (Link)

  3. Landing Page: From the drop-down menu, select the landing page you would like to use:
    • Weeks 1 and 2: Browser Language Detecting: Welcome to the Awareness Arcade
    • Weeks 3 and 4: Browser Language Detecting: Could this be Game Over?
  4. Frequency: Select One-time.
  5. Start Time: To send one PST each week during Cybersecurity Awareness Month, use the corresponding dates listed below:
    • For your week 1 campaign, select October 6, 2025.
    • For your week 2 campaign, select October 13, 2025.
    • For your week 3 campaign, select October 20, 2025.
    • For your week 4 campaign, select October 27, 2025.
  6. Sending Period: Set your campaign to send emails over 3 business days.
  7. Customize the rest of the settings as you would like, then select Create Campaign.
  8. Repeat these steps for each of the four weeks of Cybersecurity Awareness Month

images.alt:
This image depicts the configuration screen for setting up a "New Phishing Campaign."

**General Campaign Settings:**

*   **Header:** The page title is "New Phishing Campaign," with a navigation link "← Back to Campaigns" in the top right.
*   **Informational Banner:** A light blue banner displays the note: "A campaign will start 10 minutes after it is activated or created."
*   **Input Fields:** Fields include "Campaign Name" (empty text input) and "Send to," where "All Users" is selected via a toggle button, and "Specific Groups" is available but unselected.

**Phishing Templates Configuration:**

This section is labeled "Phishing Templates" with the instruction: "Template options may vary based on the groups targeted for the campaign."

**Step 1: Template Topics** (Numbered '1')

*   **Template Topics:** A selection field is populated with "Cybersecurity Awareness Month."
*   **Language:** The checkbox "Set Template Language" is checked, and the "Language Override" field displays "English (United States)."
*   **Difficulty Rating:** The dropdown is set to "All Ratings."

**Step 2: Template Selection** (Numbered '2')

*   **Template Selection:** The dropdown is set to "Specific Template (Choose one template)."
*   **Specific Template (Active State):** This dropdown menu is currently active and open. The input field displays "Please select."
    *   **Dropdown Content:** The template list is categorized by a section header: "CYBERSECURITY AWARENESS MONTH." An orange arrow specifically points to this header, indicating the current selection context or user focus. Beneath the header, a list of individual templates (blurred/redacted, but showing descriptive text and difficulty star ratings) is displayed.

**Subsequent Fields:**

Below the active dropdown, the fields "Phish Link Domain" and "Landing Page" are shown, each accompanied by a help icon (?).

This image displays a configuration section for defining the parameters of a Phishing Link and its email Delivery Details within a software interface.

**Section 1: Phishing Link**
This section defines the components of the simulated phishing URL:
*   **Phish Link Domain:** A dropdown input field currently set to "Random Domain."
*   **Landing Page:** A dropdown input field currently set to "Default Landing Pages."
*   *Note:* Both fields are followed by a question mark icon indicating available help text.

**Section 2: Delivery Details**
This section configures the timing and spread of the email delivery:
*   **Frequency:** A radio button group selection, with options including "One-time" (selected and highlighted in dark gray), "Weekly," "Biweekly," "Monthly," and "Quarterly." Followed by a help icon.
*   **Start Time:**
    *   A date/time input field, featuring a calendar icon, showing the date/time `10/06/2025 12:27 PM`.
    *   A corresponding timezone dropdown field, showing `(GMT-04:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada)`.
*   **Sending Period:** A pair of radio buttons for controlling email delivery duration:
    1.  The first option is deselected: "Send all emails when the campaign starts." Followed by a help icon.
    2.  The second option is selected: "Send emails over **3** business days." The number **3** is entered in a small input box, and the unit "business days" is selected via a dropdown. Followed by a help icon.
*   **Define Business Days and Hours:** A sub-panel for specifying the acceptable sending window.
    *   The panel header states: "Using Time Zone: (GMT-04:00)."
    *   Time range fields are defined: From `9:00 AM` to `5:00 PM`.
    *   Day selection buttons are displayed: **Sun**, **Mon**, **Tues**, **Wed**, **Thur**, **Fri**, **Sat**. Monday through Friday are highlighted in blue, indicating selection, while Sunday and Saturday are unselected.
